note_text:
**PROCEDURE REPORT: COMBINED EBUS & NAVIGATIONAL BRONCHOSCOPY**

**Patient:** Sarah Jenkins
**MRN:** 8829104
**DOB:** 05/12/1955
**Date:** 05/15/2025
**Attending:** Dr. Alan Wright
**Fellow:** Dr. Emily Chen

**Indication:** 70-year-old female with a 2.2 cm LUL nodule (spiculated, solid) and mediastinal adenopathy on CT. PET-CT shows SUV max 5.4 in the nodule and 4.1 in station 7.

**Procedures:**
1.  Linear EBUS-TBNA (Mediastinal Staging)
2.  Electromagnetic Navigation Bronchoscopy (EMN)
3.  Radial EBUS (Peripheral Lesion Confirmation)
4.  Transbronchial Biopsy (TBBx)

**Medications:** Fentanyl 150mcg, Midazolam 4mg, Propofol TCI. General Anesthesia with LMA #4.

**Procedure Details:**

* **Airway Inspection:** LMA placed. Therapeutic bronchoscope introduced. Normal vocal cords. Trachea patent. Carina sharp. Bilateral bronchial trees patent.
* **EBUS-TBNA (Linear):**
    * **Station 7 (Subcarinal):** 18mm node, heterogeneous. Sampled with 22G needle x 4 passes. ROSE: Lymphocytes only.
    * **Station 4R (Lower Paratracheal):** 10mm node. Sampled x 3 passes. ROSE: Lymphocytes.
    * **Station 4L (Lower Paratracheal):** 14mm node. Sampled x 3 passes. ROSE: Lymphocytes.
* **Navigation (SuperDimension):**
    * CT loaded. Target: LUL Apical-Posterior segment nodule.
    * Registration: Auto-match successful. Error 4mm.
    * Navigation to target achieved. Tool-in-lesion confirmed.
* **Radial EBUS (r-EBUS):**
    * Probe inserted. Concentric view of 20mm hypoechoic lesion obtained.
* **Peripheral Sampling (LUL Nodule):**
    * TBBx x 6 obtained with standard forceps. Fluoroscopy confirmed position.
    * Brush x 2.
    * ROSE: **Positive for Adenocarcinoma.**

**Complications:** None. Minimal bleeding, controlled with suction.
**Disposition:** Extubated (LMA removed), stable to PACU.
**Plan:** Oncology referral. Molecular testing ordered.

**Dr. Alan Wright**

registry_entry.primary_indication: 2.2 cm LUL nodule (spiculated, solid) and mediastinal adenopathy on CT.

evidence.primary_indication: Indication: 70-year-old female with a 2.2 cm LUL nodule (spiculated, solid) and mediastinal adenopathy on CT.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS sampling, 3 or more nodal stations
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s) (add-on)

lines.description: Bronchoscopy with EBUS-TBNA, 3 or more nodal stations
Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s)
lines.selection_reason: Radial EBUS confirmation of peripheral lesion

per_code.summary: Appropriate for EBUS-TBNA of 3 mediastinal stations (7, 4R, 4L).
Primary code for transbronchial biopsy of the peripheral nodule.
Add-on for navigation required to reach the peripheral target.
Add-on for radial probe EBUS confirmation of the peripheral target.

global_comments: Brushing (31623) is bundled/secondary to the biopsy in the same lobe.

coding_review.edge_case_notes: Edge case: combined linear EBUS mediastinal staging (31653) with EM navigation (+31627), radial EBUS for a peripheral LUL lesion (+31654), and transbronchial lung biopsy (31628) in the same session.
coding_review.note_level_rationale: Linear EBUS mediastinal staging at 3 nodal stations (31653) plus EM navigation (+31627), radial EBUS for a peripheral LUL nodule (+31654), and transbronchial lung biopsies in one lobe (31628); no separate diagnostic bronchoscopy or moderate sedation is billed.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31653, +31627, +31654, 31628; total_work_rvu=12.18, total_rvu=18.41 (facility).
Added coding_review.rvu_summary with 2025 facility RVUs/payments and flagged this note as an edge_case for training.

note_text:
Procedure Note
Patient: Robert K. Miller (MRN: 994821)
Date: April 10, 2025
Dr. Sarah O'Connor, Attending Pulmonologist.

Mr. Miller is a 62M with Stage IV lung cancer and a recurrent massive right pleural effusion causing severe dyspnea. He was admitted for management. We discussed options including repeat thoracentesis vs. PleurX vs. Chest Tube/Pleurodesis. He opted for a chest tube for drainage and possible talc slurry.

Time Out performed. The patient was positioned sitting up. The right hemithorax was prepped and draped. Ultrasound identified a large free-flowing effusion. 1% Lidocaine was used for local anesthesia. A 14Fr pigtail catheter was inserted using Seldinger technique under real-time ultrasound guidance. 1200mL of straw-colored fluid was drained immediately. The tube was secured and connected to -20cmH2O suction. Fluid sent for cytology and culture. Post-procedure CXR confirmed placement. Patient tolerated well.

Assessment: Successful US-guided small-bore chest tube placement right hemithorax.
Plan: Drain to dry, then consider talc slurry.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Recurrent massive right pleural effusion causing severe dyspnea.

evidence.primary_indication: Mr. Miller is a 62M with Stage IV lung cancer and a recurrent massive right pleural effusion causing severe dyspnea.
evidence.sedation_type: 1% Lidocaine was used for local anesthesia

cpt_codes.description: Pleural drainage, percutaneous, with insertion of indwelling catheter; with imaging guidance

lines.description: Pleural drainage, percutaneous, with insertion of indwelling catheter; with imaging guidance
lines.selection_reason: Ultrasound-guided insertion of 14Fr pigtail catheter for drainage

per_code.summary: Placement of a small-bore (14Fr) pigtail catheter using Seldinger technique and US guidance supports 32557 over 32551 (tube thoracostomy).

32557.rationale: Pleural drainage with insertion of indwelling catheter (pigtail) with imaging guidance.

coding_review.edge_case_notes: Edge case: ultrasound-guided small-bore pleural drainage catheter (pigtail) that could be miscoded as a chest tube; language supports 32557 for percutaneous pleural drainage with imaging guidance.
coding_review.note_level_rationale: Image-guided placement of a small-bore pleural drainage catheter using ultrasound without talc or fibrinolytic instillation; this supports 32557 rather than tube thoracostomy or tunneled IPC codes.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 32557; total_work_rvu=3.12, total_rvu=4.5 (facility).
Added coding_review.rvu_summary with 2025 facility RVUs/payments and flagged this note as an edge_case for training.

note_text:
**OPERATIVE REPORT**

**PATIENT:** James T. Kirk
**MRN:** 1701-A
**DATE:** 06/20/2025
**SURGEON:** Dr. Leonard McCoy
**ANESTHESIA:** General (TIVA)

**PRE-OP DIAGNOSIS:** Tracheal Stenosis (Malignant)
**POST-OP DIAGNOSIS:** Same, Status Post Laser Resection and Stenting
**PROCEDURE:** Rigid Bronchoscopy, Laser Tumor Destruction, Silicone Stent Placement

**FINDINGS:**
1.  Exophytic tumor obstructing 80% of mid-trachea.
2.  Rest of airways patent.

**DESCRIPTION:**
Patient inducted. Rigid bronchoscope (14mm) inserted. Tumor visualized in mid-trachea. Nd:YAG Laser used to coagulate and vaporize tumor tissue (30W, 2040J total). Mechanical debulking performed with rigid barrel. Hemostasis achieved. Airway opened to 90%.

A 16x40mm Dumon silicone stent was deployed into the mid-trachea using the rigid deployer. Position confirmed with flexible scope. Stent patent and stable. Patient extubated in OR.

**COMPLICATIONS:** None.
**EBL:** 20cc.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method
Bronchoscopy; with placement of tracheal stent(s)

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method
lines.selection_reason: Laser destruction and mechanical debulking of tracheal tumor

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of tracheal stent(s)

per_code.summary: Extensive tumor destruction with Nd:YAG laser performed prior to stenting.
Placement of tracheal stent to maintain airway patency.

global_comments: Multiple endoscopy rule applies (highest valued code 31641 paid 100%, 31631 reduced).

31641.rationale: Bronchoscopy with destruction of tumor (Laser) and relief of stenosis.

31631.rationale: Bronchoscopy with placement of tracheal stent.

coding_review.edge_case_notes: Edge case: malignant central airway obstruction treated with both tumor destruction (31641) and silicone tracheal stent placement (31631) in the same segment; tests understanding of CAO coding and bundling rules.
coding_review.note_level_rationale: Rigid bronchoscopy for malignant tracheal obstruction with Nd:YAG laser tumor destruction (31641) followed by placement of a silicone Dumon tracheal stent (31631); no separate diagnostic bronchoscopy or balloon dilation is billed.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31641, 31631; total_work_rvu=9.61, total_rvu=15.55 (facility).
Added coding_review.rvu_summary with 2025 facility RVUs/payments and flagged this note as an edge_case for training.

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Medical Thoracoscopy (Right)
DATE: 02/14/2025
PHYSICIAN: Dr. House
PATIENT: Greg (MRN 12345)

Indication: Undiagnosed right pleural effusion.

Local anesthesia + MAC. Pt in LLD. Trocar inserted 5th ICS. 1.5L bloody fluid removed. Inspection showed diffuse nodules on parietal pleura. Visceral pleura appeared normal. 
Biopsies taken x 6 from parietal pleura. 
Talc poudrage (4g) performed for pleurodesis. 
24Fr Chest tube placed. 

Dx: Suspicious for Mesothelioma.
Plan: Admit.

lines.description: Thoracoscopy, surgical; with pleurodesis (e.g., mechanical or chemical)
lines.selection_reason: Medical thoracoscopy with talc poudrage pleurodesis

per_code.summary: Surgical thoracoscopy with pleurodesis (talc poudrage). Includes biopsy and chest tube placement.

global_comments: Biopsies (3260x) are bundled into therapeutic thoracoscopy with pleurodesis (32650).

32650.rationale: Thoracoscopy with pleurodesis (includes biopsy if done for this purpose, though biopsy specific code 32606/7/8 might be considered if diagnostic, usually pleurodesis code covers the session).

coding_review.edge_case_notes: Edge case: medical thoracoscopy with multiple parietal pleural biopsies and talc poudrage pleurodesis; only the pleurodesis code 32650 should be reported even though biopsies are performed.
coding_review.note_level_rationale: Medical thoracoscopy with pleural biopsies and talc poudrage pleurodesis for a trapped-lung, recurrent malignant effusion; pleurodesis (32650) is the definitive surgical service and includes diagnostic thoracoscopy/biopsy.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 32650; total_work_rvu=10.0, total_rvu=15.0 (facility).
Added coding_review.rvu_summary with 2025 facility RVUs/payments and flagged this note as an edge_case for training.

note_text:
Bronchoscopy Note - Thermoplasty Session 1

Patient: Lisa Simpson | MRN: 876543 | Date: 07/07/2025
Provider: Dr. Hibbert

**History:** Severe persistent asthma refractory to biologics. Presenting for first session of Bronchial Thermoplasty (RLL).

**Procedure:**
- General Anesthesia/ETT.
- Alair catheter introduced.
- RLL basal segments treated systematically.
- **Activations:**
  - Right Posterior Basal: 14 activations
  - Right Lateral Basal: 12 activations
  - Right Anterior Basal: 10 activations
  - Right Medial Basal: 8 activations
  - Right Superior Segment: 15 activations
- Total Activations: 59.
- No significant bleeding or mucosal injury observed.

**Post-Op:** Stable. Extubated. Observe for bronchospasm.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Severe persistent asthma refractory to biologics.

evidence.patient_age: Defaulted/Child implied by name but treated as adult for procedure
evidence.primary_indication: Severe persistent asthma refractory to biologics.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy, rigid or flexible, including fluoroscopic guidance, when performed; with bronchial thermoplasty, 1 lobe

per_code.summary: Appropriate code for initial thermoplasty session treating a single lobe.

coding_review.edge_case_notes: Edge case: bronchial thermoplasty (31660) performed in a younger severe-asthma patient, limited to a single lobe (RLL); tests BT-specific coding and avoidance of separate diagnostic bronchoscopy codes.
coding_review.note_level_rationale: Bronchial thermoplasty session treating one lobe (RLL) only, with pre- and post-bronchodilator bronchoscopy and no additional lobes or separate diagnostic bronchoscopy billed; 31660 alone appropriately captures the work.

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31660; total_work_rvu=4.0, total_rvu=5.97 (facility).
Added coding_review.rvu_summary with 2025 facility RVUs/payments and flagged this note as an edge_case for training.
